conclusion: Consider the forces acting on the metal rod and the springs.
The metal rod is suspended by two springs, and the springs are not stretched when a current passes through it.
The magnetic force acting on the rod is balanced by the weight of the rod and the tension in the springs.
Analyze the forces acting on the rod.
The rod is suspended by two springs, and the springs are not stretched.
The tension in the springs is equal to the weight of the rod.
Weight of the rod is given by W = (1/2) I_1 L.
Tension in the springs is given by T = (1/2) k L.
Since tension equals weight, (1/2) k L = (1/2) I_1 L.
Consider the forces acting on the springs.
Magnetic force on the rod is given by F_B = (1/2) I_2 L.
Tension in the springs is given by T = (1/2) k L.
Since tension equals weight, (1/2) k L = (1/2) I_2 L.
Elongation of the springs is given by δ = (1/4) (I_2 - I_1) L.
Final elongation of the springs is δ = (1/4) (I_2 - I_1) L.
